Exaggerate: The claim of Nigeria President Buhari being dead is an exaggeration as there is no factual evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough evidence or support to prove that President Buhari is dead.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photographs and videos provided as evidence of President Buhari being alive are fabricated or manipulated, without any solid proof.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that President Buhari is alive and has been making public appearances, as confirmed by multiple sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Buhari is alive and has been seen in public, as confirmed by various sources.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing substantial evidence or proof to support the assertion that President Buhari is dead.
Biases not applicable: Contradict fact", "Exaggerate", "Understate", "Falters at times", "Lack enough support", "Problematic assumption", and "Exist alternative explanation" are the applicable biases in this case.
